It may be used freely by individuals for research, teaching, and personal use as long as this statement of availability is included in the text. For all other use contact the Tennessee State Library and Archives, 403 Seventh Avenue North, Nashville, TN 37243-0312. (615) 741-2764.

bibl.title: 1819 Oct. 4, Nashville [Tennessee, to] James Winchester, Cragfont [Tennessee] / J[ohn] W. Overton
bibl.author: Overton, J.W.
bibl.note: This is a letter from Judge John Overton to General James Winchester, dated October 4, 1819. Overton is writing in regards to Memphis, which he, Winchester, and General Andrew Jackson founded. Overton has had some different city plans drawn up. He writes to let Winchester know how much money he and the others involved, owe to the designer.

projectDesc.p: Created for the University of Tennessee Digital Library

editorialDecl.p: Quotation marks retained as data except inside q tags
Errors in transcription of the printed text controlled with X-Metal 2.1 spell-checker; text has also been thoroughly proofread.
Corrections and normalization represented by editorial tags.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

refsDecl.p: ID attributes provided for only those pages, chapters, or illustrations toward which a reference or figure points.

div.p:
I have got five plans of Memphis drawn in lepred
stile style by Mr Lenori of Huntsville agreeably to our determination The price of the whole is $50__ of which
Genl General Jackson pay $6.25_ you and your nephew $18.75__ and myself $25_ If convenient send your part, an I have
to send the money to Lenori in a few weeks
You will hear from me in a few weeks respecting the disposition of them and other matters respecting Memphis
